page.title: 08SOCIAL SURVEY:CARTVALE(ONE)
page.content: Four members of the Domesday team did a{social survey}using a{questionnaire for the parents of Primary 7 pupils of {Carolside}and{Busby}Schools. The survey revealed that in{Busby east 32% of the housing is rented from the District Council while in{Busby west it is only 8%.This % is falling as tenants choose to buy their houses. There are no Council houses in {Thorntonhall,Waterfoot}and in the part of{Clarkston}in the survey area.The most common house type is privately owned semi-detached although bungalows and terraced houses are also common. There are very few flats or tenements. The house sizes were:(all rooms) 4-20%;5-25%;6-14%;7-16%;8-7%;9-14%; 10 or more 4%.These figures indicate the area has many large houses many of which must be under-occupied as our survey population were families.
